VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {vertical gradient} pattern.

EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.84}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Gas on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Gas on the x-axis is {0.80}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Production on the y-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Oil on the x-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Exploration and Policy or the cell corresponding to Waste Management and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Waste Management} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Renewables and Consumption or the cell corresponding to Gas and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gas} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.28 to 0.30?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Gas, Consumption), (Renewables, Consumption), (Coal, Efficiency), (Distribution, Efficiency), (Electricity, Efficiency), (Gas, Efficiency), (Renewables, Efficiency), (Exploration, Emissions), (Oil, Emissions), (Renewables, Emissions)}.
